II. You and I are my brother as we are both born of the same mother. Since you have been acting in my favour with due trust and with a view to bringing you some permanent benefit, I have affection for you and I consider love as the reward, and I hereby transfer to you, free of charge, without any consideration, the immovable property described below, valued at Rs. 1,67,000/- (in words one lakh sixty seven thousand rupees), registered in the office of the Sub-Registrar, Maharajashri Parvathipuram (208) as Book 1 Document No. 3199/2025, and which has been in my absolute possession since that date. Therefore, from this date onwards, you are the absolute rightful owner of the vacant land that I have acquired for you by virtue of this gift deed, and you shall take possession of the said vacant land and enjoy it freely, freely, and with all rights, with your sons, grandsons, descendants I hereby give you my full assurance that this property is an undisputed property free from any mortgages, claims, decrees, court seizures, inheritance rights, charges, sales charges, tax arrears, etc., and that I have written and given it in your name with all my heart. III. Property Details: Parvathipuram Manyam District, Parvathipuram Sub-District, Komarada Mandal, Kallikota Panchayat, Kallikota Village Revenue Census, all forming part of Gram Kantham Survey No. 83-5, bounded by a vacant land measuring 20 feet (6.1 m) wide in the east and west directions and 50 feet (15.25 m) long in the north and south directions, i.e., an area of 111.11 sq. P. Usha

The above described immovable property and vacant land belong to this gift deed. This property
is not owned by the Government or any Government Institution. The property has not been mortgaged or leased to the above Institutions. There are no Government loans on this.
Declaration
We hereby certify that the property transferred by this deed does not include any trees, structures, machinery etc. and that the property transferred by this deed is not an assigned property/Government property/Endowment Department property as per Section 22-A of the Registration Act.
We hereby certify that the deed registered in respect of the property transferred by this deed has not been cancelled by any court order as per Section 22-B of the Registration Act and that no encumbrance (EC) details relating to the property have been examined and no encroachments have been made.
We agree to prosecute us as per law and may be liable to pay the applicable tax if any such factual details are found to have been concealed in this document. P. Co. ai

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 260 of 2026, dated 28/Jan/2026, executed by Pitta Usha, in favour of her Brother, Surla Ramesh, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 111.11 Sq. Yds., comprised in survey number 83-5 Part, situated in Kallikota Village and Panchayathi, Komarada Mandal, within the District of Parvatipuram Manyam, registered at sub-registrar office Parvathipuram(208), is bounded as follows: North by: Panchayathi CC Road South by: Vacant Site Of Pitta Kameswara Rao, Vacant Site Of Karu Venkati East by: Tin Roof House Of Pitta Yellamma West by: Vacant Site Of Pitta Kameswara Rao. Note: Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
